Nothing happens

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Mac
 * Safari version 11.1.2 (13605.3.8)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the new blog post view
 # Set IME to Japanese one
 # Type two letters (Consonant + Vowel) and press the Enter key to convert
 e.g.) Type "k"(Consonant) + "i"(Vowel).

h3. Expected Results

"k" + "i" is converted to "き" ("ki" = "き" in Japanese) and the cursor remains on the same line
h3. Actual Results

"k" + "i" is converted to "き" ("ki" = "き" in Japanese) but a line break is automatically inserted
h3. Notes

Converting is mandatory when entering Japanese. Though users can use other browsers/IMEs, this is affecting Japanese users badly

log for investigation
||OS||Safari||Firefox||Chrome||IE||
|Mac|y|n|n|N/A|
|Windows|N/A|n|n|n|
h3. Workaround

Use other browsers
fields.summary: Unnecessary line break inserted when typing Japanese characters in the new blog post view with Mac+Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attaching files larger than 100 MB (or  mp4 files, regardless the size) is failing if uploaded through Attachments Macro. (Drag and drop to upload or Browse for files)

h3. Update
All MP4 files are failing if uploaded through Attachments Macro.  (Drag and drop to upload or Browse for files)

h3. Description
If a user tries to upload a file larger than 100 MB - after changing the instance's max size for files - through Attachment Macro, the file upload will fail. 

However, if the user tries to upload the file by editing the page and drag-and-drop, it works as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On *Settings* > *General Configuration* change the maximum filesize to a number higher than 100 MB. e.g. 500 MB.
 # Insert an Attachments macro to a page
 # Click at *Browse Files* or *Drag and drop* the file to the Attachment macro, select a file larger than 100 MB on your local directory, then hit *Attach*

h3. Expected Results
If the file is within the filesize limit set on *General Configuration*, the file should be successfully attached to that page/space.

h3. Actual Results
The file isn't uploaded without any error displayed in the UI. 

h3. Workaround
 * Attach the files by editing the page and through drag and drop.
fields.summary: Attaching files larger than 100 MB and all mp4 files are failing if uploaded through Attachments Macro

fields.description:
One of our customers suggested to search the space key as an administrator or a user, if you want to search this because of it's "key" like in Jira in the "issue-filter".

The problem is: If a space administrator changes the space name, perhaps the system administrator or other users do not find the space easily any more, if they do not know the exact new name of the space. Perhaps a space key search might be providing easier search results, if for example a system admin knows the key and wanted to find the space like this way.

 

Is this already possible? If not, perhaps a nice feature request?
fields.summary: Search for Space Keys in Confluence Search / Filter

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Team Calendar does not display 13:00 (24hours time) when profile language set to English(US)

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
#   Navigate to https://<instance name>/wiki/admin/calendar/globalsettings.action
#  Set the time format to 13:00 24hours
#  Set profile language to English(US) from https://<instance name>/wiki/users/viewmysettings.action
#   Create a event in team calendar
#   Hover over the event and the time format display as 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Expected Results*

The time format should display as 13:00

h3. *Actual Results*

When hovering over the event, time display as 12:00 hour format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, using edit mode, it's not possible to select all text inside the Code macro using the command + A (or Ctrl + A) keyboard shortcut, as it will select all the page's content.

h3. Suggested Solution
Limit the selection inside the Code macro.

h3. Workaround
Click at the beginning of the code, press Shift and then click at the end of the code.
fields.summary: Allow selection of all text inside the Code macro using keyboard shortcut

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers have noticed that the Task Report Macro in their Profiles are not sorting and displaying Tasks correctly.

Despite completing a recent task, it does not appear at the Top of the list when sorted by Completed On Descending.

This is very problematic for customers who are trying to Track the completion of Tasks as it does not provide an accurate listing by Completion Date

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Task and Assign it to Yourself
# Check/Complete the Task
# View Tasks in the Task Report 
# Sort by Completed On Descending

h3. Expected Results
Task Report is Sorted Descending and the Most Recently Completed Task is at the top

h3. Actual Results
Task was completed on 6-Jul-2018 however it does not appear:
!TasksSortCompleted.png|thumbnail!
_also the Order does not appear to be descending, we'd expect June to be above March_

If we sort by Appears On (Page Title), we are able to find the Task and it's reference Page and the Task's Completion Date:
!TasksSortPage.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
This seems to occur in profiles that have a large number of Tasks

h3.Workaround
none
fields.summary: Inaccurate Completed On Sorting in Task Report Macro

!SpaceRestrictedPages.png|thumbnail!

none

  !page_code_macro.png|thumbnail!

 !content_of_code_macro.png|thumbnail!

 !top_to_bottom.png|thumbnail! 
# This is the final text selected:
 !selected_text.png|thumbnail! 
# Now cut the text (Command + X on Mac)

h2. Expected behavior:
# Only the first line would be displayed inside the code macro:
 !expected_behavior.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Description
In a page with more than 1.800 attachments, place an *Attachments* macro inside it.
After that, the page will display an error message like the one below:
 !screenshot-1.png! 
However, if you remove your access to *Add/Delete* Pages and Attachments from that space, the page will load as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload more than 1.800 attachments to a single Confluence page
# Edit the page and insert an *Attachments Macro*
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The page would load normally

h3. Actual Results

The page does not load. Instead, it displays an error message saying:

{quote}
*Something's Gone Wrong*
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Remove *Add/Delete* Page and Attachments permissions from the Space.
fields.summary: Something Gone Wrong message is displayed if page contains more than 1800 attachments displayed in the Attachments Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- For questions for Confluence add-on, when clicking on "edit" comment, the editor becomes blank and frozen if the code block added in the comment is empty and no text is with the code block
- Editing the comment again make the editor becomes blank and the editor box will be frozen and unable to edit or delete any longer.
- It will need to be refreshed in order to get back to original state.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Access questions for confluence add-on
2. Ask a question
3. Add a comment with any text.
4. Click on +  and choose code block
5. Choose any language and save.
6. Click on edit again 

h3. Expected Results
Should be able to edit the comment with no issues.

h3. Actual Results
Editor becomes blank and the comment box gets frozen 

*Application logs*
{code}
editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1 Uncaught (in promise) RangeError: Empty text nodes are not allowed
    at new TextNode (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at N.text (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at createCodeFragment (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at convertConfluenceMacro (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at converter (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at parseDomNode (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at t.a (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at ConfluenceTransformer.parse (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at Editor.n.handleRef (editor.8443ef706a5e5002cda1.js:1)
    at attachRef (vendor.f5092b58effb3310c81b.js:1)
{code}

h3.Workaround

If encounter this issue and wish to edit the comment again:
1) Copy the comment that is causing the issue and paste it somewhere to reuse
2) Click on "delete" comment
3) Add another comment and paste the copied comment
4) Remove the code block.
5) Add the code block again and ensure the text is right above the code block and no space between the text and the box for the code block.
fields.summary: Issue with questions for Confluence editor when code block added is empty

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a new Meeting notes in a Space, it doesn't create the index page
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space
 # Create a new Meeting notes
 # Save the Meeting notes

h3. Expected Results

An index page with all meeting notes should be created
h3. Actual Results

The index page is never created
 !Screenshot at Jul 03 20-30-56.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The current workaround is to manually create the index page:
 # Create a blank page;
 # Add the "Content by Label" macro;
 # Configure it with the *meeting-notes* label and add a filter to the current space;
 # Publish the page with the title "Meeting notes".

{panel:title=Atlassian update from 2/19/2019:}
*This has been resolved and should now be working.*

*Thanks,*

*Avinoam Zelenko*

*Confluence Cloud, Senior Product Manager*
{panel}
fields.summary: Meeting notes doesn't create the index page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Linking to the Version of a Page (Page History) leads to a Page Not Found

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a page with some versions in the *Page History*, pick one - except the current - and open it.
# Copy its URL.
# Go to another page, and create a link to the URL you've copied.
# Publish the page
# Click the link

h3. Expected Results

It should lead to the page version you've linked.

h3. Actual Results

A 'Page Not Found' message is displayed.

h3. Workaround
If you hit refresh (Ctrl+F5, CMD+R) or manually enter the URL at the address bar in your browser, the page loads properly
fields.summary: Linking to the Version of a Page (Page History) leads to a Page Not Found

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot search for custom content type with filters

h3. Description

Through Confluence search you can specify the content type you want to search for - as Pages, Blogposts, Attachments, Comments, etc.
You may also add a filter, to refine your search such as *Created*, *Creator*, *Label*, *With Parent*

However, if you search for Comments and add a filter - for example, *With Title*, to display only the comments in an specific page - the search won't return any results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a Confluence Cloud site, create a page and add some comments - inline or at the bottom of the page - to it
# Go to the full search ({{/wiki/dosearchsite.action?cql=}}) and set Type as *Custom* > *Comments*
# Then, click *Add a filter* and select a valid one - for example, "With Title" and add the page's title to it

h3. Expected Results

The search should return the results and display all comments inside the page with that title

h3. Actual Results

No results are displayed.
fields.summary: [Backend] Cannot search for custom content type with filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Anonymous users are not being able to view Jira charts gadgets, even if the Jira project allows it.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence cloud
 * Jira service Desk cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure there's a publicly available Jira project;
 # Create a page and insert any Jira chart (check notes);
 # Configure the gadget to the public jira project;
 # Publish the page and configure the space and global permissions to allow anonymous access;
 # Try to access the page as anonymous.

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to see the gadgets.
h3. Actual Results

An error is shown instead of the gadget:
 !chart_error.png|width=584,height=292,thumbnail!
{code}
{"message":"ASAP token from issuer 'micros-group/confluence' requested subject impersonation as 'username:', but no corresponding user account could be found","status-code":403}{code}
h3. Notes

As can be seen from the screenshot above, the JIRA Issue/Filter macro is shown correctly.

Affected macros (verified):
 * Issue Statistics
 * Pie Chart
 * Recently Created Chart
 * Average Age Chart
 * Created vs Resolved Chart
 * Resolution time
 * Jira issues Calendar
 * Burndown Gadget

h3. Workaround

No kown workaround.
fields.summary: Can't view gadgets related to Jira as anonymous

fields.description:
The Default behavior in Confluence is that users will receive emails when the content they are watching is changed. 

Some users have expressed their desire to be able to watch content and not receive email notifications.
fields.summary: Allow users to watch spaces/pages without receiving emails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a page includes *Jira charts* macros which reach a timeout before displaying, the page will no longer display and will instead display the error message: _Something's gone wrong_



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert more than 10 *Jira Charts* in a page with a relatively complex JQL.
# Publish the page or access it.

h3. Expected Results
The page is properly displayed

h3. Actual Results
The page displays the error _Something's gone wrong_. Following JS error in the console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'layer' of undefined
    at t.value (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/space.base.a4e24838d4f31299ee75-v29.js:1)
    at h (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at beginWork (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at o (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at i (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at k (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at _ (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at b (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at v (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at l (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Split your pages to hold a smaller number of *Jira charts* macro to not reach this timeout.
fields.summary: Too many Jira charts macro on a page will prevent the page from being displayed because of a timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is not granted to "Add attachments" space permission, he will not able to view the attachments on blog posts.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a blog post and insert an image
# Publish the blog
# Go to *Space tools > Permission*, uncheck "Add attachments" from all users/groups
# Go back to the blog post that created

h3. Expected Results
Users should able to view attachments without "Add attachments" permission as it should impact only the ability to upload the attachments as per [Space Permissions Overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/space-permissions-overview-139521.html]:
bq. *Add attachment* gives you permission to upload (attach) files to pages and blog posts in this space. 


h3. Actual Results
Attachments are showing blank:
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

After granting "Add attachments" permission, the page then working as expected:
 !screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Attachments on the pages are not affected.
* Able to view the attachments after exported the page.

h3.Workaround
Grant the users "Add attachments" permission
fields.summary: Blog Post - Unable to View Images without "Add attachments" Permission

fields.description:
I'm using a feed reader ([ViennaRSS|https://github.com/ViennaRSS/vienna-rss]) that requests feeds without sending authentication, and expects a 401 challenge before it will prompt for a username and password. Currently, I get a 302 redirection to the login page instead, which doesn't make sense for a non-interactive client.

In Confluence Cloud, {{?os_authType=basic}} used to cause Confluence to reject unauthenticated requests with a 401 (and {{WWW-authenticate: basic}}), which would cause clients to prompt for basic auth credentials. This is currently ignored, and instead a 302 redirection to the login page is served.
fields.summary: Unable to use os_authType=basic with an Atom feed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to render the Powerpoint macro inside another dynamic macro. The meta tag *ajs-context-path* in <head> cannot be referenced by macros.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a powerpoint to a page
# Add a powerpoint macro inside a dynamic macro

h3. Expected Results
The powerpoint macro with the content should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Status 404 for some macros with spinner, blank for others.

h3. Notes
The macro works outside dynamic macros.

h3.Workaround
None as of the moment.
fields.summary: Powerpoint macro does not render inside a dynamic macro

fields.description:
Problem:
Two drafts are created on create page

Steps to Reproduce:
# Go to https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work and take note of the most recent work
# Create a page (publish or not, doesn't matter)
# Refresh recent work and see there are now 2 drafts with different draftIds or 1 draft and 1 page (if published in step 2)


Have seen this problem on:
hello.atlassian.net
confluence branch deploys

Have not seen this problem on:
pug.jira-dev.com
product-fabric.atlassian.net
my personal production instance
fields.summary: Two drafts are created

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User profile macro does not update the user's info when a change is made if the instance has People Directory

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user profile macro and link it to a user
# Update the user info on People Directory
# Refresh the page with user profile macro

h3. Expected Results
The info inside the macro will be updated

h3. Actual Results
The info inside the macro doesn't update
 
h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: User profile macro doesn't update info with People Directory

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to use template variables as labels

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a way to use variables as the page's labels

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Allow variables to be used as labels on templates

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set restriction to a page
# Create a child page under that page with no restrictions
# Access that child page by another user

h3. Expected Results
A message will be shown that user is not permitted like the following:
 !スクリーンショット 2018-06-29 16.24.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The following error message is shown.
 !スクリーンショット 2018-06-29 16.19.43.png|thumbnail! 
{code}
Something's gone wrong.
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
{code}

h3. Problem Definition
This will be misleading for users because even though the restriction settings were set by someone in the instance, the error message tells them to contact Support. It takes more time than needed to get the permission settings fixes.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please see "Expected Results".
fields.summary: Improve the error message for pages with inherited restrictions

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
Unable to log in to Atlassian Apps App with iOS 12 public beta

h3. *Steps to replicate*
# [Signup and upgrade iOS 12 Public Beta|https://beta.apple.com/sp/betaprogram/]
# Install Atlassian App
# Log in to it

h3. *Actual Result*
Error popup after providing the credential:
 !Screen Shot on 2018-06-28 at 7.56.39 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Expected Result*
Able to login
fields.summary: Unable to log in from iOS 12 Public Beta

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Korean characters are not being rendered on doc files (.doc, .docx) attached to Confluence pages. Other formats work as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a doc file to a page that contain Korean characters;
 # Publish the page;
 # Preview the file;

h3. Expected Results
The document preview displays the content correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The document preview doesn't render the Korean characters.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Attach text files in PDF format.
fields.summary: Korean characters not rendering on doc files (.doc, .docx) attached to pages
Content Report Table Macro - header row sorting not working
PDF Export not working when the page contains empty Div macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a Github Links inside a table, a scroll bar cover the content from the Github Link

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a table on it
# Add the Github Link inside the table and publish it

h3. Expected Results
All the content inside the Github Links macro should appear

h3. Actual Results
A scroll bar cover the content

 !ConfluenceBug.PNG|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Github Links for Confluence don't display the content inside tables

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to create links by highlighting texts with breaks (two lines), while the same appears on the edit mode, once the page is published, the link will become only text. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# *Edit* a Confluence page
# While editing it, insert a text and use enter/return in order to break it in two lines
# Highlight both lines to insert a link
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The link should be displayed for the texts, as it's in the edit mode:
!edit.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
No link is created:
!link.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Hyperlinks break if highlighting more than one line/text break

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While selecting an attachment on a Confluence page the preview mode does not display the options bar if an office macro is added to the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an attachment to a page;
 # Add an office macro (word, excel, powerpoint);
 # Preview one of the attachments;

h3. Expected Results

The attachment preview is displayed with the options bar.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The attachment preview is displayed without the options bar.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Remove the office macro from the page.
fields.summary: Preview files does not display any options if a page contains an office macro (word, excel, powerpoint)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While selecting an attachment on a Confluence page is intermittently downloading the file instead of previewing it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment to a page; 
# Edit the page and publish;
# Click on the attachment icon;

h3. Expected Results
The attachment preview is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment file is downloaded.
 
h3.Workaround
Refresh the page until the behavior comes back to normal (open preview)
fields.summary: Selecting attachments on pages is downloading the files instead of opening the files on preview mode

fields.description:
*BUG*

In my blog posts I used to show tables and macro-generated lists of issues.
Due to the introduced fixed-width of the blog posts, the layout is now destroyed.
Tables and macro-generated lists are not readable anymore.

I don't understand this decision of introducing a fixed width.
Responsive layout means that the content should adapt to the available width.
Fixed-width makes it impossible now to use the available width.

I suggest to make this setting optional and allow for the editor to decide whatever layout he wants to use. We are using Confluence on desktop computers, a fixed-width of 600px is a very unnecessary constraint for us.
fields.summary: Fixed-width of blog posts destroys layout

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no out of the box feature to be able to search contents created/modified by a specific user and export it.  There is also no easy way to export all modied contents in a space. 

As a workaround, you can use Content User Macro to list of all the content created by a specific user. Then use the contributor field in Confluence search to search for all content that the user has contributed to. To be able to export it, you would need to access each page directly and export it. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an easier way to search for any contents created/modified by a specific user and export it. Also, add the ability to search modified contents in a space and be able to export it.
fields.summary: Ability to search the contents created/modified by a specific user and export it

fields.description:
The inline comments are good tool to highlight specific improvements areas in documentation. The only problem is when you as a page owner would like to add those changes to the document, the inline comment are not presented in editorial mode.

 

As the inline comments are very specific to a section, sentence or a word, these can easily be "forgotten" in editorial mode, especially when the pages consists of a lot text.

 

The workaround now, is to have one copy of the page open in read mode, and another in editorial mode.
fields.summary: Inline comment should be available in editorial mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using Google Chrome, attaching a custom content is not working and being silently canceled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Google Chrome (Version 67.0.3396.87)
# Edit custom content in iframe 
# Using AP.request, from within the add-ons iframe upload an image as attachment via PUT to '/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id\}/child/attachment' endpoint with options 
{code}
{
   contentType: 'multipart/form-data', 
   processData: false, 
   headers: {
      "X-Atlassian-Token":"nocheck"
   }, 
   cache: false
} 
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Attachment is uploaded.

h3. Actual Results
The request was canceled.
 !attach_canceled.png|thumbnail! 
 !dev_tools_headers.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Works with other browsers.
* The feature of uploading images has been shipped on May 12th and it did work initially. So I guess that it stopped working at some point in May or at the beginning of June.
fields.summary: Attachment upload to custom content in Confluence not working in Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While editing a page, if using Gliffy inside a Section macro, all the content, except the first line, will not display when using Firefox

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Section macro on a page
# Add some content inside the Section macro
# Add a Gliffy macro
# Publish and access the page using Firefox


h3. Expected Results
All the content(inside the Section macro) should appear

h3. Actual Results
All the content except the first line will not show
 
h3. Notes
In a different browser, it works correctly

h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Using Gliffy inside Section macro, doesn't show the content on Firefox

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence doesn't support to indent the first bullet point and to add multiple levels in bullet points.

If Confluence has this feature implemented, customers would be able to create lists more professionally. 

h4. *Steps to reproduce*
* create a bullet list and try to press tab on the first bullet
* go to the second bullet and press tab more than once
fields.summary: Allow to indenting the first bullet point and multiple indentation levels

fields.description:
Allow Page Parent-Child linking to be flipped or switched using the Reorder pages tab under content tools. Currently, a page can only be associated to a parent, however, a page cannot be made a "parent" to another page, additionally, 2 pages in with parent-child linkage cannot be flipped so the parent become the child and child becomes parent in one click.

Requested by: zolaelectric
fields.summary: Allow Page Parent-Child linking to be flipped or switched

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Admin with view and edit permissions set on a page with restrictions logging in as a user with no view and edit permissions can view and edit the page.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a page.
 * Click on the padlock icon to set page restrictions.
 * Choose Viewing and editing restricted > Apply.
 * On Settings > User management > User > choose a user and log in as the user.
 * Go to the restricted page as the user with no access.

h3. Expected Results
 * The content of the page is not shown and you receive the following message:
{quote}You don't have permission to view this page - Hit the request access button and we'll find someone who can give you access. Request access.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
 * You can edit/view the page normally.

h3. Workaround
 * None yet.

h3. Notes

* This seems to be occurring the other way around, as well. _e.g._ If your admin user do not have permissions to see a page, but the impersonated user has, you'll not be able to see it.
fields.summary: Log in as a user with no permissions on a page allows admin to view and edit page with restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The keyboard shortcut *Ctrl+Shift+V* does not work in the Confluence editor.

h3. How to Replicate

# Copy a text with some format (like a link, or a bold text)

The Ctrl+Shift+V keyboard shortcut should paste copied text as plain text inside the editor.

h3. Actual behaviour

The expected behavior does not happen. Nothing is pasted at all. (Customer has provided a video)

h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: The keyboard shortcut "Ctrl+shift+v" to paste as plain text does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Add a new module or a capability to extend the space home pages and add byline there like the other pages or an icon that vendor apps can integrate with

h3. Background
Vendor's byline links customers and sales to a page. These links provide context (what customer/sale is this page about) and link the page to the customer/sale profile (what pages are linked to this customer/sale).
When a user creates a contract, for example, it could be useful to link it to the customer that is involved in the contract.

Why do our customers need it on the homepage?
# Some users want to link a whole space to a customer/sale.
# Space home pages are just like any other pages for some users. They look and behave the same and can therefor have the same purpose. Many spaces start with an overview of involved people. This can include customers.

Since bylines are not available on the space home, vendor could use another integration point. In this case it's important to be able to distinguish space home from regular pages. (we don't want to build an integration for spaces and have it available on regular pages)

Not only could we allow them to link whole spaces to customers. We could also give them an overview of all pages that are linked to customers/sales and which customers/sales they are linked to.

So basically an overview of all the linked data in the space.
Related articles:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/lesson-1-introduction-to-the-byline/
fields.summary: Allow extension of space home pages thru byline or another integration point

When using the [Google Drive for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence] add-on, links to Google Docs are automatically converted to a macro.

As a user, I would like to have the option to display it as a link/Smart Link.
h4. Workaround (to display it as a regular link)

If you use the Link macro (*command (mac) / control (Windows) + K* or select it from the page toolbar) to enter the link, it will be added to the page as a normal link, instead of embedding the macro. Or, you can also press *command (mac) / control (Windows) + Z* after placing the link, to _"undo"_ the macro (the macro will be removed and the regular link will be displayed, instead.

h3. Summary

Customers who have made a large number of edits to a page are unable to view earlier edits if they have more than 100 Versions

 # View the Page History

h3. Expected Results

Confluence Page History paginates and allows us to navigate to a page 2, 3, etc to see older versions
h3. Actual Results

Page history shows the last 100 Versions; in this screenshot, current is Version 366 and oldest version shown in page history is 267
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
 * No practical way to see previous versions as it would require viewing the Oldest version and click on the Previous button X number of times until you find the version you need
 * Select _any_ previous version listed, then modify the {{pageVersion}} parameter within page URL to "skip" to a specific page version. Example - {{pageVersion=54}} will allow users to view version 54 of the page:
{noformat}
https://<site_name>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<page_id>&pageVersion=54
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Somehow, when accessing a page with a Table of Content macro, and then accessing a page with a table that is big enough to show a Sticky Header, the sticky header gets removed due to some inherited property.

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Access a Confluence Cloud instance
# Create a new page and insert a Table of Content macro to display all it's child pages
# Now, create a child page, and insert a big table in it
# Publish the page, and check if the sticky header is working
# If it is, go to the parent page with the Table of Content Macro (if not, hard-refresh the page)
# After the page finishes loading, go back to the page with the Table

h3. Expected Results
The Sticky Header is working as it should without any issues.

h3. Actual Behavior
When accessing the page for the first time, you can see that the Table Header has the following classes:
{code:html}
......
<table class="wrapped relative-table confluenceTable tablesorter tablesorter-default stickyTableHeaders" style="width: 100.0%; padding: 0px;" resolved="" role="grid">
......
{code}

When you access the parent page, and go back to the page with the table, one of the classes of the Table Header gets removed (unfortunately, the Sticky Header one):
{code:html}
......
<table class="wrapped relative-table confluenceTable tablesorter tablesorter-default" style="width: 100.0%;" resolved="" role="grid">
......
{code}

h3. Workaround
Hard-refresh the page so the table loads all the table's classes properly.
fields.summary: Sticky Headers removed due to page inheritance

fields.description:
If there are performance issues in Confluence (for example, Confluence pages are not loaded) and we would like to notify our users about it - "Header and Footer" is the right tool.

Problem here is that "Header and Footer" are loaded along with a page content without being prioritized. Users cannot see it - same way as they cannot see a page loaded.
As a result, it is not helpful during performance issues as users cannot see announcements loaded.
fields.summary: Move "Header and Footer" to be loaded before the rest of the content of the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a page includes *Jira charts* macros which reach a timeout before displaying, the page will no longer display and will instead display the error message: _Something's gone wrong_

In some cases, you may receive an *Access Restricted* message as well and there is actually no restrictions to the page or its parents.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert more than 10 *Jira Charts* in a page with a relatively complex JQL.
# Publish the page or access it.

h3. Expected Results
The page is properly displayed

h3. Actual Results
The page displays the error _Something's gone wrong_. Following JS error in the console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'layer' of undefined
    at t.value (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/space.base.a4e24838d4f31299ee75-v29.js:1)
    at h (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at beginWork (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at o (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at i (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at k (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at _ (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at b (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at v (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
    at l (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/app.fe95f0970d85e6b26bd0-v29.js:95)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround 1
If you update the version of your page, you will be able to view the previous version using the Page History.

Use this link to check the Page History of your page, change the instance and the page number (You can get the page number by copying the URL behind the page link):

* https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpreviousversions.action?pageId=<Get the page id from the page URL>

If you click to restore the page to the previous version, the current version of your page will become accessible on a new link, share this link with your stake holders.

*Workaround for editing the page*
Change the URL of your page to add an /edit/ before the page number, like this:
* https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<space_key>/pages/edit/<page_id>

Remember to change the instance, space key and page id if you copy this whole URL.

h3. Workaround 2
Split your pages to hold a smaller number of *Jira charts* macro to not reach this timeout.
fields.summary: Too many Jira charts macro/Jira Issue macro on a page will prevent the page from being displayed because of a timeout
